website_summaries.verdict: Though not water repellant like the Moto G7, the Galaxy A50 is worth the extra $50 for its superior camera and enduring battery.
pros: The Samsung Galaxy A50 has a solid camera, an in-screen fingerprint reader, a headphone jack and a long-lasting battery -- all at an affordable price
cons: The phone can be buggy at times, its maximum video resolution is only 1080p and the speaker quality is tinny

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on Verizon
customer_reviews.text: The one star is simply because this phone did not work on Verizon despite the description saying that it is "compatible with most major U.S. GSM and CDMA Networks." I spent 1.5 hrs chatting with Verizon and could not get the phone to work despite saying that it was on their network. I returned that phone for a replacement and the 2nd phone also would not make or receive calls.
customer_reviews.author: lildbcakes

customer_reviews.title: Phone is outstanding, unless you use ATT
customer_reviews.text: No complaints about the phone, but for some reason, ATT will not recognize it. After three days and five visits to various ATT service centers, I am returning it. Also, there is no help from the Amazon support folks. In fact, both sides directed me to the other for the solution. Not sure about the other carriers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Sprint but not Verizon (CDMA)
customer_reviews.text: Despite the band compatibility, it doesn't work with Verizon at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A50 SM-A505UZKNXAA US Version
customer_reviews.text: I had receieved my A50 Samsung Galaxy three days ago & everything just working fine. I have LTE connectivity with AT&T and running super fast. For US resident buyers, i do recommend this is the perfect model to buy. A50 is pretty much comparable to a flagship at the lowest price. The pictures are top notch. Buy the right model, i bet you will not regret.
customer_reviews.author: Mekonnen Akellom

customer_reviews.title: Could have been better
customer_reviews.text: There are two things to a smartphone experience: a) the phone feature- mic, speaker, and associated experience, and b) the smartphone experience. I will be succinct in my feedback. The phone failed miserably on its phone experience- speaker quality is sub-par, on smartphone side, its average-screen is good (not great), camera is sub-par, screen touch is slow and freezes. Only good feature is that the battery lasts well over a day.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Sent me a used one!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the phone great features like face recognition. But I think I got a used one that was unhappy. I would like a brand new for I paid the full price. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: shravya_satara

customer_reviews.title: good deal on an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Up grade from a Huawei Honor 5 went back to Samsung this time and I am glad I did. Set up was easy enough sept for the sim chip from my old phone was to big so I had to make a short trip to the local ATT store for assistance. All the rest of the set up was basically handle by Google. Still learning the differences, but am really place with this purchase. Only downer was that Amazon offered the same phone wit a free Sam sung fit watch. Bad timing I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Burnam

customer_reviews.title: Works fine on Verizon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on Verizon. I read some of the other reviews stating that it does not work, and was concerned. I tried it, and it works fine. Be aware that there are multiple versions of this phone and that Amazon may be combining the reviews from all versions. The version that I purchased is the U.S. Version.
customer_reviews.author: M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy A51 Unlocked (US Version) with earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: (Straight Talk) I just bought me and my wife one of these phones each and we are very happy with them Upgraded from an S7 and an iPhone 6s through Straight Talk. Copied all info over, with smart switch (app) and swapped the active Straight Talk sim cards from our current phones to the new phones (No sim card included in this phone) and they work perfectly. Phones also arrived a week before they were due, which was great. The ear buds are very nice also. However I must note that there were separate charges for the phone and ear buds, it was equal to the total listed price tho.
customer_reviews.author: David Abel

customer_reviews.title: Works on Verizon
customer_reviews.text: This phone works great on Verizon. To those having problems getting it added to Verizon, your mistake is telling Verizon what you’re doing. They won’t have the serial numbers for these phones in their system. Just swap your SIM card over to this phone and it’ll work like a charm. This phone is good value for money. Screen is fantastic. Has several of the most common features for flagship phones at a fraction of the price. It won’t be the fastest or have the most RAM but it does the job for most basic phone tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Ingram

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work with att, tmobile, sprint, cricket, boost, or verizon.  A WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: doesn't work with att, tmobile, sprint, cricket, boost, or verizon. A WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.author: Dill

customer_reviews.title: Bogus!! Not compatible with Sprint
customer_reviews.text: The description said that this phone was unlocked by Samsung and it was CDMA compatible!! Lies upon lies!! After purchasing this phone I went to my phone carrier service to get it activated and was told that it would not work with Sprint. That it would not connect at all. Waste of time and would not recommend to purchase at all!
customer_reviews.author: Chi

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: After a series of horrible events with my S10, I was looking for an inexpensive replacement to allow me to get stay in contact via my AT&T account. This phone proved to be an ideal substitute. Living without the fingerprint reader, which was inconsistent at best (or my fingerprint miraculously changed on a near daily basis) has not been a problem. The lack of edge screen, with a case always difficult to read, has not been life changing. This is a good phone for those who do not need all of the extras that expense brings with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Looks good in the ads but this is a big disappointment for $250. Most importantly, the unlocked version is missing the CRITICAL T-Mobile & MetroPCS frequencies. That makes it a high-priced call-dropper! Beautiful screen but funky Samsung customized Android system. Buy the Motorola Moto E6 instead and get the T-Mobile/MetroPCS frequencies AND SAVE $150. That's what I did.
customer_reviews.author: Trusting Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Phone for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this and started using it today. So far I love it! My S10 decided to give out on me. I didn’t want to spend too much, so far so good. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Madie Hillen

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: The thing I love most about this phone is the camera. I am in love with the quality and resolution 😍
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Not  unlocked when it was supposed to be
customer_reviews.text: Basically a rip off. Don't sell phones as unlocked when they aren't.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for a great price!  Easy setup using AT&T prepay
customer_reviews.text: I was still using my Galaxy S7 and finally had to upgrade. I am not disappointed! I am an AT&T prepay customer and all I had to do was switch my sim card. Everything from my Samsung and Google accounts were right there. I've only been using it for 5 days but so far so good. The fingerprint scanner was giving me a hard time at first, but then I realized I had added my fingerprint before putting my protective screen on. So I added a new fingerprint with the screen on and I haven't had a problem since.
customer_reviews.author: Ty in PA

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Electronics, deceit masters, selling defective devices
customer_reviews.text: Phone came defective, Amazon support tried to help. Then got connected to Samsung support and they only wanted to repair it. As if I had purchased a used device. Way to treat your customers Samsung. I will be going back to LG. I wanted to give them no stars but apparently Amazon requires 1 star to post the review...
customer_reviews.author: Lord Mitovius

customer_reviews.title: Missing earbud and clear case in package
customer_reviews.text: I read that the phone comes with a wired earbud and a clear case for the phone, they were not in mine package. The phone itself is very underwhelming, I understand now why people say Pixel 3a is better. All the features feels gimmicky(under the screen fingerprint reader, face recognition, camera, etc.), I'd rather they focus more on making the budget phone perform better. The only good thing of this phone I think is the screen and battery, which to be honest is not even that impressive, it's just closer to what a flagship phone would have comparing to other half-baked features.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Really Happy.  Amazon
customer_reviews.text: when I ordered this phone I was worried.. when it arrived I received the wrong on... needless to say I let them know right away.. and they replaced it right away.. when the replacement arrived, I was extreeeeeamly happy.. they sent me a brand new phone it was unlocked and loaded with no problems.. So far the battery life is awesome.. I wanted to get mine first before getting one for my daughter.. I am extreeeeeeamly happy with Samsung, the phone itself, and amazon for really jumping on a problem that has their stamp on it..
customer_reviews.author: Momma Tj

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than the A20 - Cheaper than a Note
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone. Thin - Light - Large Screen. I was going to move to Consumer Cellular and decided to get a new phone when I did. I had a choice of ATT or T-Mobile and selected ATT. I am pleased with how quickly this phone connects with my ECHO for the Auto. (Which I love!) It seems fast - calls are clear - very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Zardoz

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS WITH VERIZON!!!
customer_reviews.text: To be clear I got the US version model number SM-A505U1, 64GB, 4GB RAM and i have a Verizon prepaid plan. I first did all the updates on the phone (about 5 of them as of 2/10/2020) and i then just popped in my SIM and SD cards. The phone had to restart to apply the SIM card settings and when it came back up it worked perfectly. I was immediately able to text, call and the Internet worked with no issues. I do not know what these folks with Verizon are doing for it not to work but mine worked without issue, hope this helps someone on the fence.
customer_reviews.author: benpritchard

customer_reviews.title: A Realy Good Phone
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this phone for a little over a month and it offers everything a person could want in a cell phone. Great size for viewing e mails, and outstanding camera, and a solid value for its price point. Oh yes it does very well for calls, and texts.
customer_reviews.author: Ken the Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Below par phone
customer_reviews.text: Phone freezes periodically and blanks out. I like the size and features but that's it. Isn't worth the heartache. Battery life is below par as well. I cant get a full day on a full battery
customer_reviews.author: Errol

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH BOOST MOBILE
customer_reviews.text: I loved the phone however, I had to return it because Boost Mobile does not have this phone on the list as being a phone you can use. So before you purchase a phone that is unlocked make sure your carrier allows it or you will be in my situation. I really hate I had to return it, but I loved all the features it offered, it was delivered on time and in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Excellent flagship replacement
customer_reviews.text: I previously had an S9 but didn't like the curved screen. It also lacked a few things this phone has like the 3rd lens and I hated the fingerprint reader on the rear. The A50 has a better screen, better cameras, costs less than half and although it lacks a front led for the camera and the through-screen fingerprint reader is a bit slow and doesn't always work the first try, it is still an excellent phone and only someone who comes from the "early adopter" camp wouldn't be happy. It's definitely the best mid-range phone on the market today and blows away many top-line models.
customer_reviews.author: rvinid

customer_reviews.title: Would not work on Verizon
customer_reviews.text: After 2 hours at the Verizon store and 1.5 hours on the phone with Verizon technical support, we couldn't get it working. Verizon instructed me to return the phone because it wouldn't activate. We tried factory resets, safe mode, turning on and off hd calling/wifi calling, turning on and off airplane mode. Unfortunately, nothing worked. The Verizon people thought the phone might be defective.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Tough phones.
customer_reviews.text: I like this phone a lot. I've had expensive phones from HTC and Motorola. I've had 3 cheaper Samsung phones. The only difference verses thev high end is the camera quality. One thing about Samsung is the toughness compared to the other phones. I'm sold on this brand.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the shape and the ready quick assistance the phone gave when prompted. Was able to activate my number without going in to my service provider.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great device on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved to give the phone 5 stars but I rated 4 it's a really nice device everything works well and battery life is awesome. The only con I have is it doesn't use wifi calling and I live in a dead zone and my cell is my life line so I cant use the device as I would like so I'm currently stuck with my bug phone still !
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Got this phone for my wife, so far she really likes it. We got a sd card to expand the memory (only 32gb), she takes a lot of pictures. The camera works great and takes very clear pictures. This a great phone for the price and has many of the same amenities that are in the more expensive phones. We put the verizon sim card in and it worked right away.
customer_reviews.author: Talyr

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy A10e: maybe not the latest technology, but good value
customer_reviews.text: I am a cheapskate, so when I really needed to upgrade my smartphone I looked for one with good functionality and a modest price. After several months with the A10e, I've been happy with its performance on voice, internet, and battery life.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW R BEAN

customer_reviews.title: The touch sensitivity not good and the games freeze alot.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone thinking it will work great no problems but when i tested out the games that i have on my samsung galaxy s8 , on this phone the game free fire it freezes my character just runs straight and i cant stop it unless i turn the screen off and on then i tested it on call of duty mobile and the touch and movements are so slow and then this phone touch is slow i don't regret buying it but it wasn't a good idea to get it 🤦‍♂️good looking phone though.
customer_reviews.author: Kyonosuke

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my wife's phone from Samsung S7 Active to this one. Here is what she loves about it: Battery: This phone is still at 60% by night (and she was using it all day between social media, streaming, etc.). Her old phone would have been dead by now. Camera: PHENOMENAL camera! Why do I need to pay $800 for an S10 when I get a better camera for less than half the price? So far, I do not have any negatives that I heard from her about the phone (which is great) so nothing negative to report.
customer_reviews.author: Rami Aboumahadi

customer_reviews.title: works with cdma carier 100% verizon is good
customer_reviews.text: beautiful and crystal display . camera on this phone is not awesome like they trying to tell us, image quality is good but don't try to get good quality picture on low light, also there is no cling in the Box only phone ,charger and USB cable
customer_reviews.author: Boban Georgijevski

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded to the A50 from the S7.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded this phone from a Galaxy S7. I am very pleased with the Galaxy A50. I Had no problem whatsoever transferring it to Metro by T-Mobile. Everything works like it should and the phone itself was beautiful. This phone has 64Gb internal memory. 4Gb ram memory. To my surprise it has Samsung Pay. The in screen fingerprint sensor works flawlessly. The face reader...the same...flawlessly. By the way, 3 cameras on the back, one at 25Mps and the front selfie camera at 25Mps just WOW. Lots of the bells and whistles of the flagship phones at half the price, or less. I will recommend this phone for anyone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Boost
customer_reviews.text: Crap. Reviews and description says works with Boost. Boost says "This device is not eligible" WTH.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Photos and Works with Metro!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is amazing! Dont freak out if it doesnt register your phone service u just call your provider and they will activate it for you! Works great with Metro Pcs! Huge widescreen phone feels like an XL phone. 25 mpxl selfie camera is so clear! Runs fast and smooth!
customer_reviews.author: Dolly

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Yes - it works with Boost mobile. I had to purchase a new $10 SIM card but worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great phone very surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Was very reluctant to order a phone outside of a actual retailer. Upgraded to the Galaxy A51 for husband who refuses to pay $1,000. for a phone! The staff at Verizon and T-Mobile all agreed this phone is amazing at a price of $399.99 in store, best price on Amazon. I am an iPhone user and once I got this "mid-range" phone set up and running, I think I'm going back to Android ;-) I need the $1,000 phone for my work, but seriously that A51 will do the trick as well. I'll probably downgrade to the Samsung Galaxy A51. I'm a fan! Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Hettish

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: After very disappointing experiences with a few other droid phones and based on reviews, I decided to give the Galaxy A50 a shot. Wow! compared to the other crap droid phones I had, I was really surprised by how well the A50 works. Responsive graphics, great face recognition, awesome camera and surprisingly good battery life. Another reason I settled on this phone was due to my son. About a month ago, I bought him an A10, which he said he is very happy with. I've owned this phone about 3 weeks now and so far, I'm happy. I hope I haven't jinxed it with a positive review ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Eric O.

customer_reviews.title: Value of this phone is worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. I'm just like the S10 works great and everything didn't have a problem I have AT&T service so it works on AT&T Network
customer_reviews.author: donald p

customer_reviews.title: I love it, everything it's claimed to be
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect right out of the box. I'm on a CDMU system and I've read that some are having problems. The only reason I can figure is they bought overseas version instead of the american version. I was skeptical but decided to try it anyway. Glad I did. So nice I ordered another for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: It was worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something with a mid-range price tag but still had basically all the same features as the Samsung Galaxy S10. Yes, the A50 is a little slower. Yes the camera isn’t as great. Yes, the fingerprint scanner isn’t the best. But, the price is right. And this is not a cheap, crappy phone. This phone does exactly what I need it to do. Unless you play lots of video games on your phone, or take professional photos or videos, or like mountains of debt to impress people you don’t even like, then you don’t need the top $1000 phone. This one will do perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Not the latest version of Samsung phone but the A50 does everthing expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant originally to order an unlocked phone due to problems from other's experiences. This purchase was without any issues and worked perfectly out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: BRP727

customer_reviews.title: ATT Compatibility
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung Galaxy A10e phone we bought from Amazon was not compatible with ATT; it is Model # SM-A102U1. The ATT compatible phone is Model # SM-A102U (without a 1 on the end). If you can get us the ATT compatible Model # SM-A102U then we will return this Model # SM-A102U1. Compatibility issues are mainly with voicemail. I had searched Amazon for ATT compatible phone and then made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Barry A.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've upgraded from a VERY old flip phone to this one. There's LOTS to learn, but I've gotten it up and working OK. I didn't rate the fingerprint reader or face recognition features, yet, because I haven't implemented them yet. It looks like a great phone. It has a wonderful camera!
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd E. Sponenburgh

customer_reviews.title: Like an iphone but cheaper and an android
customer_reviews.text: I just got this phone and I love it. I had everything saved to my Google account so it immediately synced with my phone and I had no issues getting things to download onto it. It works with tracfone and total wireless. From what I can tell it has everything the iphone 11 has minus facetime. If you want an iphone like phone but love android I suggest this phone. The only thing I don't like is that it does not use a normal android/ universal charging cable.
customer_reviews.author: Bree Vining

customer_reviews.title: Phone not compatible with my carrier.
customer_reviews.text: Even though the phone was unlocked from Samsung and CDMA was the correct service for my carrier. This phone would not communicate with my carrier. I was pasted my 30 days of return. So I have to find a carrier that will work with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: ATTENTION METRO USERS, don't panic if the store is unable to get it working, go home & call 611 they'll walk you through it & wave the 15 +10 fees the store charges....... I was so nervous about buying a unlocked phone but it actually works!!! My only advice is buy a US version, they coast slightly more but I feel like it's worth it
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie B.

customer_reviews.title: screen cracked in 15 after buying
customer_reviews.text: I hardly ever write reviews. First time I buy Samsung. After about 15 days of use screen cracked. Phone was not dropped or hit. Amazon would not accept a return because is past 30 day period. Called Samsung and they said screen cracks invalidate warranty. As if their screens can never fail by themselves. Samsung asked me to take drive 25 mi to a repair center just to find out they don't repair galaxy A20s. Called Samsung again and they asked me say to send the phone; I would be 2 weeks with no phone at all. not worth it. Warranty is useless and customer service wont help you.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fregoso

customer_reviews.title: Great For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This phone was purchased as a second "tethered" phone (my first phone is a Galaxy S10) for driving rideshare. To be honest, I like the screen on this cheaper phone better than the OLED screen on the S10. This phone isn't as fast and doesn't have the storage of the more expensive phones, but works great and this bundle is almost unbeatable. The case fits perfectly and so does the screen protector. Love it and would buy again! If it had more storage and was a little faster, it would be my first phone!
customer_reviews.author: IvoryDawg

customer_reviews.title: New or not?
customer_reviews.text: The phone was so unused that it arrived with some of the manufacturers protective plastic wrapping still attached. All apps so far work as they should and I'm getting approximately 30 hours of battery with a bunch of apps open. A great buy. I will update this review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: George K.

customer_reviews.title: IS NOT CDMA!
customer_reviews.text: I can't write an honest review on the phones cause IT DOES NOT WORK ON BOOST MOBILE. Amazon is pothetic about allowing this to trick us into thinking it would work with CDMA
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT CDMA Compatible!
customer_reviews.text: Product marketed as unlocked, CDMA and GSM compatible. This phone is NOT CDMA compatible. Buyer beware. ☹
customer_reviews.author: T. Randall

customer_reviews.title: No WiFi calling
customer_reviews.text: The product review says this phone has WiFi calling. This phone does not have WiFi calling. Either the seller does not understand what WiFi calling is or flat out lied about it. I have at&t and cricket the cricket wireless does support WiFi calling however this phone does not have WiFi calling which is why I wanted this phone. So I could have service using my WiFi at home which has a low cell signal coverage to no cell service coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Shearin

customer_reviews.title: Yaaaay! Eh.
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews that others left. You'll see a pattern. This phone is just a little off from perfect, everywhere though. Its a good phone but a bit pricey to be this laggy, or just ok at face recognition and fingerprint reading. Its just underwhelming I guess. Looks good though.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: I don't care what other reviews said. I am on Verizon and went to the store to get a new sim card. They put it in with a sd card I bought and all went perfectly. The only 2 features missing from the S series are wireless charging and waterproof. I am comparing to my S7 and I like this phone so much better. Just got it for my wife and still learning it but I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Wandel

customer_reviews.title: Phone continually freezes up
customer_reviews.text: I had great expectations for this phone since I have always had great luck with Samsung. With that being said I was very disappointed in this Samsung Galaxy. The biggest problem was the fact that it froze up many times which required the phone to be rebooted often. I definitely expect better operation from any phone. I didn't like the size of the phone however I could have lived with if the phone operated properly. The camera didn't focus and it was very difficult to get a clear picture. I returned the phone and will try a different unlocked phone. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Joe403

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a quality phone for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice phone for someone who is not looking to spend between $600 and $1,000 a phone, but does not want a piece of junk either. I have nothing negative to say about it. my entire experience has been positive so far. By the way it works fine with Verizon. I had an issue when originally I put my SIM card in. I could only get Wi-Fi and I could text but could not make or receive calls. We went online and added the phone ID to our Verizon account under my number and that took care of the issue.
customer_reviews.author: A.M. Bookdragon

customer_reviews.title: Decent phone for a Samsung.
customer_reviews.text: Decent phone for a Samsung. But what makes ZERO sense is why the International Version is 128GB & 6GB Ram for an average of $100 less than the US Version 64gb & 4 GB RAM. The international handset is not compatible with ANY Carrier in the US due to the IMEI number being international. The camera is overall good, but often takes blurry images more than regular. For video there has to be a fair amount of light otherwise it comes out black. But in the same amount of low level light regular pix come out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J. McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Screen cracked quickly, otherwise good
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for my kids for Christmas (2 from Amazon and 1 from Walmart). I bought cases and glass screen protectors. It hasn’t even been 3 months and all 3 of them have cracked screens. One of the batteries is already going bad and not holding much of a charge. Other than that, this phone runs pretty well and the graphics are good. My kids play a lot of games and stream a lot, and really never have any complaints. For what they cost, these phones are decent, but I wish I would have splurged on slightly better phones so I don’t have to continually be replacing screens.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is so much better than the Moto phone I bought last year, which had so many problems which finally rendered the phone unusable, even after a factory reset. The only reason I haven't given it 5 stars is that there are a few things that make the phone harder for me to use. I choose to keep it unlocked, which seems to affect the appearance of the clock and placing apps on the home screen. But overall, I'm happy with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Karma

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as described
customer_reviews.text: I have T Mobile and this phone worked for me. Nice looking phone with excellent camera but other than that it is a very low quality phone. Finger print reader and face recognition barely work. Apps run slow on this phone. Phone is not very durable. First phone replaced by Samsung because screen stopped working after 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: DarkAngel27

customer_reviews.title: Works great and works with AT&T
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t expect much from this low budget phone, but it has worked so far and transferring contacts, messages etc from my 5 yr old Sony Xperia using Samsung Switch app was easy. I have AT&T and installed my old SIM card from my old Sony phone and it work without a hitch. Why only 4 stars? The weight is lighter than I’m used to which is just my preference. Would I buy this phone again? Most definitely!
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, with some issues
customer_reviews.text: Honestly a pretty solid phone so far! Works with Verizon Straight Talk. Battery is good, display is beautiful, love the camera and storage, many little things to discover with this phone. Finger print scanner is pretty bad, but I knew that prior to buying that, just having the scanner in the screen was just a bad idea. Also for some reason when I'm calling or video chatting, the other person hears a scratching sound. Still very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work on Verizon
customer_reviews.text: Does not work on Verizon. My SIM card otherwise works perfectly fine in my old Moto G5 Plus Backup Phone. Yes, I have the US model that is supposed to work on Verizon. I do NOT have the international dual SIM model. Will be returning this Samsung Galaxy. What a shame. How could they screw this up???
customer_reviews.author: W F R

customer_reviews.text: So worth the purchase! The Galaxy A50 is much more advanced than the Galaxy s10. Larger screen perfect for seeing what you're doing. I love the 64GB storage because my last phone it was pulling pins & needles just to have all of my apps & pictures at once. 10/10 would reccomend & buy again. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rose

customer_reviews.title: Affordable alternative to the flagships lines...
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Sprint once you find a working SIM card. SIM Part# SIMOLW416TQ Its also a flat screen and bright. Its not curved like the S8... curved screens are stupid.
customer_reviews.author: RomanS

customer_reviews.title: did not work well with sprint
customer_reviews.text: i wish it had worked with sprint its a pretty phone though.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: A great phone for upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Had a Samsung S5, version 6, that was not cutting it anymore. Slow, no ram left, little SIM card usage. Time for a new phone. This new phone is great! Fast, lots of RAM, good SIM usage, great screen presentation, biometrics, and quality photos. I don't know what a better phone can do, this phone does it all in all the areas and I am very happy. Suggest it to anyone who wants to upgrade to a new phone without paying an arm and a leg. Because it is a open source phone, it can be used by many different carriers.
customer_reviews.author: steven r. pitts

customer_reviews.title: AT&T Customer
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't write reviews however after seeing mixed reviews I had too! My phone works perfectly fine with my sim card.. I got it about 12 P.M. it's now almost 10 P.M. The set up is very simple and very easy to use. The fingerprint scanner is a little slow, other than that it works great! Just be sure to order the US Version of the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Good phone maybe mine was a lemon?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this was supposed to be new, package locked original and not tampered with, but when I opened it only had Chinese instructions and missing accessories. Had to take it to AT&T because settings were in mandarin, AT&T said they get used phones and put new screens & battery covers on to make them look new. But he showed me the date on the battery was different then the phone manufacturer date from being replaced. Phone kept shutting off and restarting randomly and would drop calls or sound like talking through a tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but performs well
customer_reviews.text: It came quickly and I had no issue with setting it up with Verizon. Works well. Much less expensive than the top models and honestly it really isn't noticeably worse. I stream Netflix and hulu with no issue. Wifi works better than my old work issue galaxy G9. Considering the price, I see no reason to get those top line phones. Even if this phone lasts 1 year, buying one of these once a year is still more cost effective than buying a top phone.
customer_reviews.author: michael rorer

customer_reviews.title: The Samsung A50 is a great phone.
customer_reviews.text: THe A50 is an excellent phone at a great price. I very much pleased with the speed and the operation of the Android software. Very quick and long lasting charge. Purchased it unlocked so I can easily move to any phone plan.
customer_reviews.author: DRL

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Durable?
customer_reviews.text: Does Not work for verizon voice and messaging. Works for Sprint just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Item could not be activated.
customer_reviews.text: My Samsung Galaxy A10e US Version Factory Unlocked Cell Phone with 32GB Could not be activated by several different carriers. I had to return this product and request a refund. I'm still without a phone today.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for half the cost of the s10's and s20's
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone. I had the A50 and decided to buy this one there is not a ton that has changed between the 2 however the fingerprint sensor is so much better on the 51 than the 50 and the 51 has double the internal storage and an extra camera. Otherwise I feel that they are pretty close in comparison. I've been a Samsung person for a while now and am pleased with this. My battery life is good however I have found that mid to late afternoon on some days I am having to charge my phone not to sure why with a 4,000mah battery. But overall I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Best android phone on the market
customer_reviews.text: Due to the COVID19 pandemic, I made the decision to order a phone online, rather than going into a store. I upgraded from my Samsung J7 Crown to this and I'm so glad I did. It is very user-friendly and has a crisp, clean display. This is the most expensive phone I've bought in quite some time, but it is well worth it because it is the highest quality.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: This is my first smartphone.
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning how to use it, my previous phone was a flip phone for a very long time, so this is all new to me, but so far it's been working well and pretty much what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This phone is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone on September 21st here we are 6 1/2 months later and it already won't hold a charge. Do not order thos item.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine Rock

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Mid-Range Phone
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for six days, I like it a lot. New, replacing a Moto x4. This phone is smooth, and no lockups. Just moved the micro-SIM from one phone to the other, works flawlessly. Samsung hit the mark with this phone, I am very pleased with my purchase. No more Moto for me. I like using Bixby, no issues there, but what I really like are the Bixby Routines. These routines are highly customizable, very cool what you can do with them. This Samsung phone is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: nice mid-range upgrade from J7
customer_reviews.text: Works with TracFone Verizon sim card. Upgraded from J7 Crown, better screen, better camera, more memory, and bigger battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dadssmartfone

customer_reviews.title: didnt work out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: recieved the phone and turned it on, however the screen did not work. what a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: cody hafford

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone Great value
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Samsung S3 which by the way was still working well. Just some of the newer apps would not run on it. I read a lot of reviews about this phone and if you want a phone that performs well( I don't play games or watch TV on it) this is a great phone. The display is great, charges fast, and has a great feel to it. I wish it was about 1/2 inch less in length but it really hasn't been a detriment.
customer_reviews.author: dbld

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: Great phone at much less than Galaxy S10 price. Great battery life.
customer_reviews.author: David Fox

customer_reviews.title: A complete lemon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my Mother and finally got around to setting it up for her. It took me almost an hour transferring all her content from the old Samsung phone. Data connection is non-existent. It will not load a web page nor will it hold wi-fi. I checked all settings and did everything possible but it's not happening. What a disappointment and complete waste of time. I use a Note 10 plus and we've had many other Samsungs over the years and never had an issue. Thank goodness we found this out within the return period or I would be out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: professor R.

customer_reviews.title: You cant activate the phone
customer_reviews.text: Tried for 3.5 hours to activate was told it was a bad phone.
customer_reviews.author: Wade B.

customer_reviews.title: No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: I had originally ordered the A20s but cancelled and decided to go with the A20 after watching some YouTube comparison videos. The colors are vibrant and user friendly. Wanted a new/updated phone without spending too much without compromising quality. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: SHINeeGrl90

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pictures!
customer_reviews.text: The first phone I ordered didn't work, so i sent it back. This one worked perfectly, was easy to transfer from my last camera via Wifi, even though I am not a teckie. The fingerprint reader works most of the time, but it's almost faster to put in your pin. The camera is fantastic with very clear pictures. Only negative is it's a very slippery phone and I'm having trouble finding a case that easily fits. I recommend to anyone who likes Android.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Collins

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Samsung A20. Camera takes great pictures but burst mode isn't available if you save the pictures directly to the memory card. Fingerprint reader isn't all that great. It can take a while to get an accurate response. Therefore I just set a passcode. Apps run fine but I really don't use games all that much. I use apps for shopping, banking and streaming.
customer_reviews.author: WJE4378

customer_reviews.title: Buy a dog, receive a cat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a unlocked, and I received a locked cell phone. I had to spent extra $110 to unblock new Verizon/Samsung cell phone. That's not good to any customer. I felt betrayed by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JVSEGHESSI

customer_reviews.title: This phone is NOT captable with Verizon
customer_reviews.text: This phone is not capable with Verizon. After spending approximately 3 hours to activate and set this phone up, I contacted Verizon directly. Over a 3 day period, 4 tech support personnel and about 12 hours it was determined by the 4th level (highest Level) tech support that the phone was not receiving not emitting a signal. The antennae was not functioning. I had received my SIM card from Verizon prior to trying to activate the phone.. I was alerted that this is an ongoing problem with this Galaxy A50 phone obtained from Amazon. I returned the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon White

customer_reviews.title: Smart phone with smart price. Double check cord
customer_reviews.text: Great price, feels like a different world after being on a Samsung s7 until now. Definitely worth the price. Camera is good. Only problem was that I was sent a micro-USB instead of the required USB-C charger cord.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Door to insert sim card wont open.
customer_reviews.text: Brand new phone. Tool does not open door to insert sim card. Tried for two days. On my way to Samsung store for assistance. Not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: No headphones! Display is meh. Both orig and replacement had bad screens
customer_reviews.text: I guess it’s because it’s a budget phone. But I was expecting for the screen to be in better condition. Both front cameras has light bleeding (bright white streaks). I bought one and returned it due to the bleeding, surprisingly the second one had it too. I guess all of them has it then? Doesnt include headphones! Despite the poor display, it isn’t that all bad. Audio quality is decent, the facial recognition is pretty fast and so is the fingerprint scanner. It isn’t that fast but it’s expected from a budget phone. I still decided to keep mine anyway but some credit would be appreciated to compensate for the missing headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the phone
customer_reviews.text: I have been pleased with the Samsung A20 phone. I cannot review any of the "fancy" things it may be able to do since I primarily use it as a phone, GPS, and to take e few pictures. My old phone was...old...So at this price, the phone is great.
customer_reviews.author: JanSeashell

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: It's a good price but camera is bad quality unfortunately, not one single picture is postable. Better off with a A20 or A21, OR A51.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly U.

customer_reviews.title: Needs SD card or doesn’t hold much of anything
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone really works just fine with my att SIM card And looks good to Only thing is can’t download much unless you buy an Sd card My problem is I don’t know what one to get Any one know?
customer_reviews.author: juanita Rouse
